I'll be giving a short presentation during the custom modules session at Dev day around one of our use-cases that kind of shows the potential, but it's more about using VueJS, custom modules, and the contacts API together. In that example I made a Vue instance that worked as an interactive quiz that submitted CRM data (via Zapier) without using a form, without a page refresh, and remained "semi-smart" as the contact's email was pre-populated using HubL if it was already known. This was a simple client example, but shows what's possible.

I'll be building something similar in the coming months dealing with a client that wants to use internal HS landing pages as a dispatch system... that's going to be fun. In their case, they want to be able to input new customers (and have their information also be asynchronously sent to their accounting system), search for existing customers in the CRM and edit their information (they don't want these employees in the CRM directly), and schedule service calls that will be reflected in a third system. Lots of AJAX will be going on in that project, believe me lol. Not sure if I'll use Zapier for it, but I'm 99% sure all of that will be possible.

As shown from above, I mainly deal with the contacts API, but these methods could be used on any endpoint. Do you have any specific use cases in mind?
